azurerm_sql_server.description: Manages a SQL Azure Database Server.

name.description: The name of the SQL Server. This needs to be globally unique within Azure.

resource_group_name.description: The name of the resource group in which to create the SQL Server.

location.description: Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

version.description: The version for the new server. Valid values are: 2.0 (for v11 server

administrator_login.description: The administrator login name for the new server. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

administrator_login_password.description: The password associated with the `administrator_login` user. Needs to comply with Azure's [Password Policy](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms161959.aspx)

connection_policy.description: The connection policy the server will use. Possible values are `Default`, `Proxy`, and `Redirect`. Defaults to `Default`.

tags.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

type.description: Specifies the identity type of the SQL Server. At this time the only allowed value is `SystemAssigned`.

fully_qualified_domain_name.description: The fully qualified domain name of the Azure SQL Server (e.g. myServerName.database.windows.net)

principal_id.description: The Principal ID for the Service Principal associated with the Identity of this SQL Server.

tenant_id.description: The Tenant ID for the Service Principal associated with the Identity of this SQL Server.

storage_account_access_key.description: (Required)  Specifies the access key to use for the auditing storage account.

storage_endpoint.description: (Required) Specifies the blob storage endpoint (e.g. https://MyAccount.blob.core.windows.net).

storage_account_access_key_is_secondary.description: (Optional) Specifies whether `storage_account_access_key` value is the storage's secondary key.

retention_in_days.description: (Optional) Specifies the number of days to retain logs for in the storage account.

create.description: Used when creating the SQL Server.

update.description: Used when updating the SQL Server.

read.description: Used when retrieving the SQL Server.

delete.description: Used when deleting the SQL Server.
